title: Luminary Tour: Monet and Chicago
hero_caption: Claude Monet. Irises, 1914/17. The Art Institute of Chicago, Art Institute Purchase Fund.
short_description: Connect with fellow Luminary members on a guided small-group tour of Monet and Chicago.
list_description: Connect with fellow Luminary members on a guided small-group tour of Monet and Chicago.
description:
Connect with fellow Luminary members on a guided small-group tour of Monet and Chicago. You’ll delve deep into the exhibition, the first to explore Chicago’s pioneering connection to the great Impressionist artist, and gain a fresh perspective on Monet’s life and work.

This event takes place when the museum is closed to the public and will last approximately 50 minutes. Open exclusively to Luminary members, tours require advance registration and are limited to eight participants. View all upcoming Luminary programs.

Physical distancing and other visiting policies must be observed. These include but are not limited to wearing a face covering and not attending if you are experiencing any COVID-19 symptoms.

Coat and bag check, dining, and valet services are currently unavailable.

Find further information on What to Expect on our website.

Contact Us

If you have questions or are interested in learning more about Luminary membership, we’d be delighted to hear from you. Please contact us at (312) 443-3735 or luminary@artic.edu.
buy_button_caption:
$50 per person

This tour is limited to eight participants.
